author: trent_vanepps
content: Is there a good primer outlining how forks might work in Eth2? Naturally occurring forks, malicious forks, contentious protocol upgrades, etc

author: trent_vanepps
content: I imagine the main differentiator is slashing and how that plays into 51% attacks

author: protolambda
content: <@420951281910284289> The spec describes the fork-choice for an implementer, and the FFG (https://arxiv.org/pdf/1710.09437.pdf) paper deals with the more intricate details of forks (And I think more work is published soon). Also Vitalik recently wrote an ethresearch post covering less technical parts of the 51% attack case in POS: https://ethresear.ch/t/responding-to-51-attacks-in-casper-ffg/6363
